description: Borrowed from Latin palpitō, palpitātus (“throb, pulsate, palpitate”).

verbs.description: palpitate (third-person singular simple present palpitates, present participle palpitating, simple past and past participle palpitated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To beat strongly or rapidly; said especially of the heart.
examples: When he just looks at me, my heart begins to palpitate with excitement.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to beat strongly or rapidly.
examples: The allergy medicine palpitates my heart.
